intro: Diplotaxis crassifolia f. webbiana, commonly known as the thick-leaved synanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its robust, succulent stems and thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, typically arranged in racemes, and it produces pods that contain seeds. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
